alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Mason (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 8:44AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Meigs, northeastern Gallia, northern Mason and central Jackson Counties through 930 AM EDT... At 844 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Point Pleasant, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Point Pleasant, Gallipolis, Ripley, Pomeroy, Racine, Ravenswood, New Haven, Mason, Sandyville, Middleport, Syracuse, Hartford City, Henderson, Cheshire, Portland, Mount Alto, Lakin, Cottageville, Evans and Letart. This includes Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 132 and 154. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
